for_sales.sales_text:
Marshmallow is a 21foot  Blackwater Sloop built in Maldon by Dan Webb and Feesey c1968.  She is carvel and gaff rigged,  has two berths in cabin and pipe cot in focsle.  There is an original Baby Blake sea toilet,  Taylor’s stove and a Yanmar 1GM engine.  Engine was professionally serviced before Covid19 restrictions and has not been used since.  The boat has been layed up ashore under covers at Rochford for several years. It is believed that she is in good structural condition but in need of some recaulking prior to paint and varnish.  Sails are in good condition and dry stored.

Marshmallow has been in the same ownership for the last 55 years and has sailed East Coast waters extensively out of Paglesham in Essex.  Sadly,  her owner and former OGA member passed away earlier this year and his family have asked me ( as his friend and sailing companion ) to try to find her a new owner.  They are more interested in her finding the “ right” owner than in any money - although any donation to the RNLI in the memory of Ivor Henry Jones would be appreciated. If you are interested in Marshmallow please contact david.hanchet@btinternet.com who can arrange for you to view her ashore at Sutton Wharf Boatyard ( Carter & Ward ) Rochford, Essex.
for_sales.summary: new owner found not through the OGA
